title: Rulers using religion to justify rule

content.description: “It is most evident that kings, queens, and other princes . . . are ordained of God, are to be obeyed and honored by their subjects; that such subjects as are disobedient or rebellious against their princes, disobey God.”
content.question: An Homily Against Disobedience and Willful Rebellion, Church of England, 1570 What could most reasonably be concluded from the sermon above?

choices.label: The clergy generally appointed kings, queens, and princes.
Rulers often used religious ideas and institutions to justify their rule.
Rulers were most often chosen from members of the clergy.
The clergy believed in the separation of church and state.

content.answer: Rulers often used religious ideas and institutions to justify their rule.
